column5: Yeah, 50mms in Alliston will blow out that river with ease.  Unless you like fishing chocolate milk, I'd find something else to do.
Other than fishing?!
I should have said 'another fishing venue'
Thanks Joey, it was a consideration at one point. Good thing we thoght better of it...    That's what I keep telling Sandra.    You wanna take my place??
It's my anniversary and I have another wedding to go to today. I don't think I'll be fishing.  But tomorrow is a different story
it's not too bad here so I may go out shortly but that all depends on what the Mrs has to say about getting ready for my daughters b-day party today.
Purple = bad!
There will be lots of salmons!!!!   Catchings salmons with my 5 diamonds in the back!
Im pier fishing, and I can tell you that I'm hoping for buckets!
Couple inches of rain overnight and strong northwest winds starting in the morning.
OH HAPPY DAYS FOR THE FLOGGERS.
Great day to stay home, play cards and order some Chinese take out!!!
Will be out bass fishing..... great. better have the rain coat ready to go. haha
Not a fan of fishing in 100% rain forecast in a boat or on bank. Everyone going out,good luck,better you than me. Lol.
2 day tourney for me so no choice, haha
Of all the weekends eh?geeez!
Looks like a off shore wind that's not bad
They just canceled the heavy rain fall here. River might be safe for the morning.
As long as the wind isnt reaaaallly bad..... Ill be out!
?  Still 40 mm in forecast foe 'da Beach'.
DA BEACH??
I'll be tying a knot tomorrow...but not a fishing knot.
Wasaga
Congrats Jer, hope it is not an outdoor event!!!!
What you should be hoping for is a north wind to push all that warm water away.
Suppose to be good luck if it rains on your wedding day - so I am told. Congrats Jer!
I haven't fished since Wednesday...  so I was looking forward to it. If it's not too crappy out I'll be out. Just bought a rain suite so I should be alright
40mm at the Beach isn't going to do anything to the river...  Now, 40mm in Alliston is a different story.
Actually I'm hoping for a southernly wind (in port dalhousie) but a northernly wind wouldn't be bad as I can easily change it to bronte and I'll end up going more often anyways.
Yup, south wind @ Port D would be great.  I used to fish those piers ALL the time when I was a kid..  Harbour is great for browns as well.
40-50 for Alliston. But best to stay away. The fishing will be lousy!!
